snippet: The openly gay N.F.L. prospect Michael Sam said that he saw football as salvation during his childhood in tiny Hitchcock, Tex. His father is still struggling with the news that his son is gay.
abstract: Profile of National Football League prospect Michael Sam, who is poised to become a trailblazer in the sport after publicly coming out as gay; challenges that lie ahead of Sam are but another step in a life that has been filled with difficulties that made him look to football as a salvation.

byline.original: By JOE DRAPE, STEVE EDER and BILLY WITZ
byline.contributor: Joe Drape reported from Columbia, Mo.; Steve Eder from Hitchcock, Tex.; and Billy Witz from Los Angeles. Susan Beachy and John Branch contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: The openly gay N.F.L. prospect Michael Sam said that he saw football as salvation during his childhood in tiny Hitchcock, Tex. His father is still struggling with the news that his son is gay.

headline.seo: Michael Sam’s Troubled Upbringing in Texas
headline.main: Before Coming Out, a Hard Time Growing Up
headline.print_headline: Before Coming Out, a Hard Time Coming Up
